He was asked to accept the honorable office of bishop. But he closed the matter with a determined refusal. It was enough for hirn, he said, that, with- drawn from his beloved solitude, he had come by divine direction to that province to live among the messing, crowding throngs. Nevertheless he wished to give a pattern to the monks, and urged them to follow earnestly in the steps of the sainted fathers, and thence to gain instruction in holy conduct. They must strive, he admonished them, that he who hath forsaken parents and the world look not back and desire the allurements of worldly display which he had sought to escape.
